hints.title: Explicit Convergence Rate
hints.content:
621: :label: thm-explicit-convergence-rate
622: 
623: Under regularity conditions (Assumption 3.2.2), for any smooth function $\phi \in C^2(\mathcal{X})$:
624: 
625: $$
626: \left\| \Delta_{\mathcal{F}_N} f_\phi - \Delta_g \phi \right\|_{L^2(\mu)} \leq C(\mathcal{X}, g, T) \|\phi\|_{C^2} \cdot N^{-1/4}
627: $$
628: 
629: with probability at least $1 - \delta$ for $C = C(\delta)$.
630: 
631: **Component-wise breakdown**:
632: 
633: | **Error Source** | **Rate** | **Condition** |
634: |------------------|----------|---------------|
635: | QSD convergence | $O(N^{-1/4})$ | Hypocoercivity (Ch 11) |
636: | Finite sampling | $O(N^{-1/4})$ | Optimal bandwidth $\epsilon \sim N^{-1/(2d)}$ |
637: | Bandwidth bias | $O(\epsilon^2) = O(N^{-1/d})$ | Smoothness assumption |
638: | Velocity thermalization | $O(e^{-c\gamma t})$ | Fast friction limit |
